turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I wish you wouldn't take the dog with you, David -- he's likely to be a burden to you.

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: I got to, Mama. I know Daddy wants to see him.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Here's your food -- now you go straight to that place -- if you need to rest, go into a church or railroad station -- but don't go into nobody's house, you hear me?

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: Yes, mam...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Ask your daddy to give you some word about when he'll be comin' home -- and tell 'im we love him.

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: I cut it on some glass and we got lost, Mama.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Did you find your father?

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: Didn't see 'im, Mama. The other men there say they didn't know Daddy.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I guess they musta sent 'im to another camp.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What's that you carryin'?

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: Some books Miss Johnson gave me.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Who's Miss Johnson?

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: Miss Johnson is a teacher, and...

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: So when I left, she gave me these books.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Miss Johnson must be a real kindly lady.

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: She is, Mama...  When the fall comes, she wants me to come to her school.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: How can you do that? You don't live anywhere near that school.

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: She says I can come live with her while school goin' on, and come back home every time there ain't no school.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: But who's gonna help me here with the house and in the field?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What's wrong with him, David?

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: It's the heat.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: It's when the heat is so bad, dogs go crazy.

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: He won't go mad -- he's just lookin' for a cooler spot.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What's wrong, Nathan?

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: He can't get up, Mama!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Be good and be smart, little boy.

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: Yes, ma'm...

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: We brought your laundry, Miss Boatwright.

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: Come in, children.

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: This is for your mama's work, and here's something for the three of you.

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: Thank you, Miss Boatwright.

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: It's about the Three Musketeers.

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: Thank you, Miss Boatwright.

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: When you read it we'll talk about it...

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: Yes mam... We gotta go, Miss Boatwright.. .

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: Tell Rebecca I said 'hi', now...

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: Would you like to have a cool drink, David?

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: No, thank you -- I gotta go do some work in the field today.

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: I'll find out where your daddy is for you.

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: Thank you, Miss Boatwright!

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: Don't mention this to anyone! You hear me, David!

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: You know where my father is, don't you, Miss Boatwright?

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: No, he was wrong, David, I didn't find out.

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: But I saw you -- you looked in there, and you found out, Miss Boatwright.

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: If I tell you I didn't, David, that's what I mean.

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: But, Miss Boatwright, you--

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: I don't know a damn thing, now stop bothering me about it!

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: Come, I'll take you home.

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: I'll walk...

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: Don't pout now, David, it's a long trip.

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: I'm used to it.

turns.speaker: MRS. BOATWRIGHT
turns.text: Hello, David...

turns.speaker: DAVID LEE
turns.text: Hi, Mrs. Boatwright...  I'm sorry 'bout the way I acted the other day, Miss Boatwright.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: If they heard me sing like this up North I'd be richer than the man I sharecrop for.

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: And if they saw me pitch the way I did today -- they'd hire me just to strike out Babe Ruth!

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: You know, one time by mistake I went into a white church down in Row County and to this day I don't know how'n the devil I got outta that church alive.

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: They probly thought you was crazy.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: I guess so -- but I went home and did me some praying to the Lord. I said, Lord, I went into this white church down in Row and all I want you to tell me is how I ever got outta there in one piece.

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: What did the Lord tell you, Ike?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: He said, I don't know, Ike -- you doin' better'n me, I been tryin' to git in there for 200 years and ain't make it yet!

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: Hi ya doin' there, Ike?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Any time it's Saturday and I don't hafta do any work, I'm doin' okay!

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: Whatcha got there?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Seems this piece of mail came to Mr. Howard's place this mornin' and he had me to bring it over here.

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: Well, let me have it.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Don't belong to you! It's for the little important man, here!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Don't take all day at that table, David Lee.

turns.speaker: JOSIE MAE
turns.text: Mama, when kin me and Earl go to school with David Lee?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Maybe soon--

turns.speaker: JOSIE MAE
turns.text: Mama, why did they take Daddy away?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Because he cared so damn much about you and me, child.

turns.speaker: JOSIE MAE
turns.text: Is he gon' be gone long?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Might be...

turns.speaker: JOSIE MAE
turns.text: Mama, what was we laughin' for?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: At the way you ask funny questions, Josie Mae!

turns.speaker: MR HOWARD
turns.text: Rebecca, you jest the one I wanta see.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I brought these walnuts to trade.

turns.speaker: MR HOWARD
turns.text: That's one dollar an' twenty cents.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I wanta get some things.

turns.speaker: MR HOWARD
turns.text: I hope it ain't a lot,'cause I can't give you no more credit till the croppin' season gits back, that is if Na--

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I didn't say nothin' 'bout credit, Mr. Howard.

turns.speaker: MR HOWARD
turns.text: Whatcha wanta order?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I need some nutmeg, flour, eggs, sugar, and...

turns.speaker: MR HOWARD
turns.text: Dammit, I'm talkin' to you, woman! I gotta farm to think about and I need answers.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: The season is a long way off, Mr. Howard, and by that time, Nathan oughta be home. If he ain't, believe me -- the children and me -- we will grow the crops. We have to because we owe you all that money -- Mr. Howard.

turns.speaker: MR HOWARD
turns.text: Hi ya, Rebecca...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Tired.

turns.speaker: MR HOWARD
turns.text: Somebody told me Nathan was back. How is he?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Why don't you pay him a visit, Mr. Howard? He'll tell you all about it.

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: Night, son!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: And don't wake up Josie Mae and Earl!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I bet you could use a hot cup of coffee, Nathan Lee.

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: I shore could, Miss Rebecca.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: The boy done went into my walnuts! I skin my fingers to the bone to pick two pounds that's worth almost nothing at the commissary and he done took almost half of what I pick!

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: The boy is hungry, Rebecca.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: We been through these off-seasons before -- we made it.

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: What we make it to? The next season to work ourselves to death, share croppin' for ol' man Howard, so he can get richer and we can't even eat when the croppin' time is done?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Good mornin', Nathan.

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: Mornin'...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You ready to eat?

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: I'll wait till after the children.

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: How's the weather out there?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Little chilly.

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: Hope it don't freeze out our baseball game today!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: If there ever was a devil in this county, Ike, you is it!

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: Ike, you could make a song outta that!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: The most important thing is that you're home!  We was gonna have cold eatin' tonight, 'cause of the heat, but now, I'm goin' to cook!

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: Well, let's get to it, Miss Rebecca,'cause I been waitin' too long a time for your good cookin'!

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: What did he want?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: To invite you to his house -- the two of you could just sit under the shade tree, drink ice cold whiskey, and just shoot the breeze!

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: Did you tell 'im I was too busy for that kinda stuff?

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: Well, let's get to work!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You sure you feel up to it, Nathan?

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: Yeah. I feel real up to it right now. Come on, David Lee, you and me'll do the loading.

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: This done happen before. It ain't nothin' -- I just have to wait a minute or two.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Is there something I can do to help you?

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: Yeah, just stay where you is...

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: There, you see?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I see, all right -- It's time for us to get out of this field.

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: I just got out here!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: It's lunchtime, and I wanna have a talk with you, Nathan Lee. Come on, children...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Where you goin'!?

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: To the commissary to get this boy some clothes! I'm gon' get everybody somethin'!

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: But, Nathan--

turns.speaker: NATHAN LEE
turns.text: Don't tell me nothin' 'bout what we owe ol' man Howard! I'll do the owing, and let him worry 'bout the collecting! Come on, David Lee!

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: No, I ain't got no word yet, Rebecca. I went to the courthouse yesterday to see 'bout it, but they just won't tell me nothin' about what labor camp Nathan was sent to. I'm sorry, Rebecca.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: It's a shame, Reverend. It's a damn shame.

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: I hope you don't take to bitterness, Sister Morgan. I tell you like I tell all the women in this church who got the same trouble you got. No matter what the trial or what the misery is, I tell 'em to stay with God.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Yeah, he'll crawl into my bed tonight, lie close to my body and keep me warm -- and rectify the evil in the men who live over us in this valley.

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: It's not that simple, Sister Rebecca -- the Lord works in mysterious ways -- we come into this life with nothin' and we'll leave it with nothing.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Is that a blessing, Reverend?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF YOUNG
turns.text: Howya do, Rebecca. I sorta been expectin' you this mornin'.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I wanta see Nathan.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF YOUNG
turns.text: I wish I could, Rebecca, but I can't let you.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I don't understand that, Sheriff Young.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF YOUNG
turns.text: It's the rules and I gotta follow 'em. No visitin' 'cept holidays and Sunday -- and no womenfolk anytime.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You mean to tell me I can't see my own husband?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF YOUNG
turns.text: That's the way they do things here in Landsdown. I just follow orders.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I got to see my husband, Sheriff Young!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF YOUNG
turns.text: I'd like to help you, Rebecca. But all that would do, is git us both in trouble.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Will they give him a trial?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF YOUNG
turns.text: Shore thing -- next week sometime, and as soon as I git the day, I'll ride out and let you know 'bout it.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: You gotta low-life job, mister sheriff!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: What...

turns.speaker: BIG THING
turns.text: Behold my glory.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: What... are you?

turns.speaker: BIG THING
turns.text: I am the clitoris.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: The clitoris?! I DID IT!! I FOUND THE CLITORIS!!

turns.speaker: BIG THING
turns.text: Stan, your friends need you. They are in trouble and you must help them.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Wait, you're supposed to tell me how to get Wendy to like me.

turns.speaker: BIG THING
turns.text: There are more important matters right now...

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: NO WAY, DUDE! I'VE LOOKED ALL OVER FOR YOU, AND NOW YOU HAVE TO TELL ME HOW TO GET WENDY TO LIKE ME!!

turns.speaker: BIG THING
turns.text: Dude, she's eight years old, just get her some ice cream or something.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Of COURSE!! Ice cream!!

turns.speaker: BIG THING
turns.text: Now go, your friends are in danger... The USO show is a mile east of here, just over that ridge. The clitoris has spoken.

turns.speaker: KYLE'S MOTHER
turns.text: Oh but OF COURSE children are going to see it!!

turns.speaker: CANADIAN MINISTER OF MOVIES
turns.text: Uh, can I finish? Can I finish? ...The fact is that we Canadians are quite surprised by your outrage-

turns.speaker: KYLE'S MOTHER
turns.text: YOU JUST DON'T CARE!

turns.speaker: CANADIAN MINISTER OF MOVIES
turns.text: Can I finish? Hello? Can I finish? ...The United States has graphic images of violence on television all the time, what is that one show? COPS? And car crashes caught on tape? We can't believe that a movie with some foul language and fart jokes would piss you off so much.

turns.speaker: KYLE'S MOTHER
turns.text: BECAUSE IT'S EVIL!!

turns.speaker: CANADIAN MINISTER OF MOVIES
turns.text: Can I finish? Please? Can I finish? ... ... Uh... Okay, I'm finished.

turns.speaker: CANADIAN MINISTER OF MOVIES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KYLE'S MOTHER
turns.text: The Canadians are just mad that we mothers here in South Park have the chutzpah to stand up to them!  Like it or not, Mr. Canadian Minister, OUR children are now safe from your Canadian smut!

turns.speaker: DOCTOR PANGLOSS
turns.text: Patient 453 here has been fitted with the new v-chip...

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: My head hurts.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR PANGLOSS
turns.text: Don't worry about that. Now, I want you to say 'Doggy.'

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Doggy.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR PANGLOSS
turns.text: Notice that nothing happens.  Now say 'Montana.'

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Montana.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR PANGLOSS
turns.text: Good. Now 'Pillow'.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Pillow.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR PANGLOSS
turns.text: Alright, now I want you to say 'horsefucker.'

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: OW!! That HURT GOD DAMMI-

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: OW!! YOU CAN'T DO THIS TO ME!! THIS ISN'T FAIR!!! YOU SONS A BITCHE--

turns.speaker: DOCTOR PANGLOSS
turns.text: Success!! Our device works perfectly! We will begin mass production immediately!

turns.speaker: MR. GARRISON
turns.text: Well, anyway... Today children, our friend Mr. Hat is going to tell us all about the environment.

turns.speaker: MR. GARRISON
turns.text: That's right, Mr. Garrison. The environment is what surrounds us. It is what we live and breathe.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: I hate the environment.

turns.speaker: MR. GARRISON
turns.text: Eric! Did you just say the "F" word?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Fragile?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Why the fuck not?

turns.speaker: MR. GARRISON
turns.text: Eric!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Fuckin' a right.

turns.speaker: MR. GARRISON
turns.text: How would you like to go to the principal's office?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: How would you like to gargle rat jiz?

turns.speaker: MR. GARRISON
turns.text: WHAT DID YOU SAY?!?!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: I said -

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Dude!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: What? Fuck you guys, I wanna get out of here.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Come on, you guys... We have to THINK!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: About Cheesy Poofs, dumbass! This whole thing has gone too far!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: To free Terrance and Phillip.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: But you guys... It's Salisbury steak.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Chef, do you know anything about women?

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: They're burning all the Canadian stuff cause of the war.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: That book wasn't Canadian!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: -no Cheesy Poofs.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: -No Cheesy Poofs... What the hell is happening?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: And my mom has become so bu-sy that she's raising heck and ignoring me I agree that there is now a battle to be won! Something must be done!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: But what are we going to do against this entire army?

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Is it Cartman's mom?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Very funny!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Oh, son of a bitch!  AAGHGH!! I mean, son of a biscuit!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Maybe THAT'S who your father is, Cartman!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: I saw him last night!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Fuck that!  AGAGH!!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: We're going... Let's run through the plan!!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Holy shit Cartman!  What was that?!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: How the fuck should I know!!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Dude, this is seriously lame. I didn't know we were gonna get all dirty and stuff.

turns.speaker: THE MOLE
turns.text: Sheet!

turns.speaker: THE MOLE
turns.text: Cartman, over zere, is the electrical box. You must sneak over zere and shut it off before I return with Terrance and Phillip or the alarms will sound and I will be shot full of holes. Got it?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: THE MOLE
turns.text: You MUST shut off the power, this is VERY IMPORTANT do you understa-

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: I HEARD YOU THE FIRST TIME! I'M NOT LOU FERIGNO FOR PETE'S SAKE!

turns.speaker: THE MOLE
turns.text: Ze alarms! Zey went off!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Yeah... That was my bad, sorry.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Aw, screw it. It probably isn't all that good anyway.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Cartman! What the hell are you talking about?! You LOVE Terrance and Philiip!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Yeah, but the animation's all crappy - it probably can't sustain itself over ninety minutes.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: How come Terrance and Phillip are so weird looking?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Cuz, dummy they're Canadian, just like Ike!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Dude, that movie was fucking sweet!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: You bet your fucking ass it was!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Suck my balls.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Yeah, Shut your fucking face, Unclefucka!!

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Dude, how can you hate the environment?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: 'Cuz, dude, it's all sticky and airy and fragile and stuff. I fucking hate it.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: I can't dude! We all took a sacred oath, and swore ourselves to secrecy!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: It was the Terrance and Phllip movie!

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Man, that movie gets better every time I see it!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Yeah, but you know what? That whole part about lighting farts is bullshit. You can't do that.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: I bet him he couldn't do it... I bet him a hundred dollars!

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Come on, Cartman. It's not your fault.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: No, I know. I'm just fucking STOKED I don't have to pay him!

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: I can't believe he's dead.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Yeah, I'm having total deja vu right now. Like this has all happened before...

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Who the hell made up that law?!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: You can't do this!! Have you ever HAD Cheesy Poofs? They're a taste sensation with a delightful cheddar crunch.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: But they fucking didn't do anything wrong!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Yeah!  And what rim job expert went and outlawed Cheesy Poofs!?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: WHAT THE HELL WAS THAT?!

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Dude, they cut out 92 minutes!

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Hey Cartman.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: You know, me and Stan were just talking about what a fat fucking hunk o' fat fuck you are.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Oh yeah?!  Well you're a monkey-shit-

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: This is all cause of your mom, Kyle. She's such a bitch-  AGH!! I mean - she's such a... meanie.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: And she's getting worse...

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Come on, just get to the message board!

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: I'm trying, I can't find a Canadian server... I've got to break into the main frame...

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Bingo. Okay, here we go...  Want to help Terrance and Phillip? Meet us for a meeting at Gladdy's barn tomorrow night...

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Tell 'em we'll have pie and punch.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: We're not gonna have pie and punch!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: More people will come if they think there'll be pie and punch!

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: pie and punch... This is Top Secret. The password is...

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: You're late, Cartman!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: I had to ride my bike here. My behind is killing me.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Your behind?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: I have to say 'behind'! I get shocked if I say 'ass-  OW!!!

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Did you bring the pie and punch?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: No you guys... Something happened... You guys wanna hear something creepy?  I don't think Kenny is dead.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: I know Cartman, I know.  I see Kenny every day.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: YOU DO?!

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Sure, dude.  On the face of every child, on the smile of every baby...

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: You guys! Seriously! You guys!

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: What Cartman?!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Kenny! I saw Kenny again!

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Cartman?!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Whoops.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: CARTMAN!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: WAGAGAHGHGH!! YOU GUYS!!! SERIOUSLY!!!

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Mph rmpmh rm.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Mph rmph rm!!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: No you can't Kenny!

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Mph rm rmph!!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Okay Kenny, I'll bet you a HUNDRED DOLLARS you can't light a fart on fire!

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Mph mm!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: GO AWAY, KENNY!  IT'S NOT MY GOSH DARN FAULT!

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Mph rmprmmh rm!!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: I don't have proofs of purchases from Snacky Smores, Kenny!

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: MPH RMPH RMPH RMPH RM!!!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: AGAGAH!!

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Mrphmmmph!!!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Okay.    Not.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN'S MOTHER
turns.text: Look, Eric it's your little friends.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: What the hell are you guys doing here?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN'S MOTHER
turns.text: Eric!  Don't talk to Ms. Brovlofski that way!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: But mom!  I'm not fucking addicted to fucking bad language!  I don't have a fucking problem!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN'S MOTHER
turns.text: Goodnight, honey.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Mom... When is the war gonna be over?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN'S MOTHER
turns.text: I don't know honey. Soon we hope. You want it to end quickly, huh?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Oh, I don't care, I was just asking cuz all my favorite TV shows have been replaced by news and it's pissing me off.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN'S MOTHER
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Mom...

turns.speaker: CARTMAN'S MOTHER
turns.text: Yes, hon?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: If you went down on a horse... You'd tell me, right?

turns.speaker: CARTMAN'S MOTHER
turns.text: Sure, hon. Goodnight.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN'S MOTHER
turns.text: Eric?! Eric, what is it?!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: I saw him!! I saw Kenny!!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN'S MOTHER
turns.text: Oh you poor dear. You've been through so much...

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: I bet him he couldn't set himself on fire and now he's all pissed off!!  AGH! I can't say pissed off?!  AGH!!

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: Ugh... You guys, seriously... I'm having Cheesy Poof withdrawal...

turns.speaker: MR. MACKEY
turns.text: Mkay, kids from all over the State have been brought here, because you all share the same problem. Uh, young man... Let's start with you.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: You've got a stupid accent too.

turns.speaker: MR. MACKEY
turns.text: Eric, that is not appropriate.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: What? Fuck French people. Fuck 'em in the ear.

turns.speaker: MR. MACKEY
turns.text: Mkay, you see, children. This is exactly what I'm talking about. We have to change the way you think.

turns.speaker: MR. MACKEY
turns.text: Mkay.

turns.speaker: CARTMAN
turns.text: God Damn it your mom is a bitch, Kyle.
